name: angular-formatter
comment:
All of the core formatters available in Angular. This library is included as part of angular.dart.

A formatter is a pure function that performs a transformation on input data from an expression. You can extend Angular by writing your own formatters and providing them as part of a custom library. See the @Formatter class annotation for more detail.

Formatters are typically used within {{ }} to convert data to human-readable form. They may also be used inside repeaters to transform arrays.

For example:

{{ expression | uppercase }}

or, in a repeater:

 <div ng-repeat="item in items | limitTo:2">

class.name: Arrayify
class.preview: Transforms a Map into an array so that the map can be used with ng-repeat.

class.name: Currency
class.preview: Formats a number as a currency (for example $1,234.56).

class.name: Date
class.preview: Formats a date value to a string based on the requested format.

class.name: Filter
class.preview: Selects a subset of items from the provided dart-core.List and returns it as a new dart-core.List.

class.name: FormatterModule
class.preview: This module registers all the Angular formatters.

class.name: Json
class.preview: Converts an object into a JSON string.

class.name: LimitTo
class.preview: Creates a new List or String containing only a prefix/suffix of the elements.

class.name: OrderBy
class.preview: Orders the the elements of a list using a predicate.
